title: Aurient.ai Selects/Experience styling, category labels, and image behaviors

requirements.summary: Restyle the Selects section to more closely match Aurient.ai’s Selects typography, spacing, card layout, and hover interactions while keeping existing Tailwind theme tokens.
acceptanceCriteria: Selects section header, grid/card styling, and hover interactions visually align more closely with Aurient.ai’s Selects section (within the constraints of the existing design tokens).
No changes are made to immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

file_operations.description: Update the Selects layout/typography and card hover behaviors to more closely match Aurient.ai’s Selects section while keeping existing Tailwind theme tokens. Continue using shadcn-ui Card/Badge primitives for consistent styling. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Create a reusable section header component to standardize Aurient-like typography hierarchy and spacing for Selects/Experience headers without changing theme tokens. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the new SectionHeader component usage by updating Selects/Experience sections imports/usage as needed (ensure no orphaned UI and the sections remain in the same scroll order). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Add minimal utility classes (via Tailwind layers) supporting Aurient-like card hover/transition polish (e.g., subtle border/gradient/glow helpers) while preserving existing OKLCH theme variables and tokens.

requirements.summary: Restyle the Experience section to more closely match Aurient.ai’s Experience typography, spacing, timeline/card layout, and hover interactions while keeping existing Tailwind theme tokens.
acceptanceCriteria: Experience section header and timeline/cards visually align more closely with Aurient.ai’s Experience section (within the constraints of the existing design tokens).
No changes are made to immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

file_operations.description: Update Experience timeline/card layout, typography hierarchy, and hover states to more closely match Aurient.ai’s Experience section while keeping existing Tailwind theme tokens. Continue using shadcn-ui Card/Badge primitives where appropriate. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Ensure SectionHeader supports Experience’s title/subtitle layout variants (alignment, spacing) to match Aurient-like hierarchy. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
Extend any shared timeline/card interaction utilities needed by Experience (e.g., timeline rail dot/line helpers), keeping existing theme tokens intact.

requirements.summary: Ensure Selects and Experience category labels display only Aurient.ai’s concise uppercase labels (AI, ART, TECH, CRYPTO, CULTURE) instead of longer strings.
acceptanceCriteria: Where a category label is rendered in Selects and Experience, it uses one of these exact uppercase labels: AI, ART, TECH, CRYPTO, CULTURE.
The UI does not display the previous longer category strings (e.g., “Protocol Positioning”) in the category label position.

file_operations.description: Add a small mapping/normalization utility that converts existing content categories into one of: AI, ART, TECH, CRYPTO, CULTURE, and provides a safe fallback behavior that never renders the old long category strings in the category-label position.

Update category label rendering to use the new category label mapping utility so only AI/ART/TECH/CRYPTO/CULTURE appear in the category label position. Keep styling aligned with Aurient-like uppercase label presentation. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Update category label rendering (if/where displayed) to use the new category label mapping utility so only AI/ART/TECH/CRYPTO/CULTURE appear in the category label position. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Adjust selects content metadata to support the new concise label scheme (e.g., add/replace with a displayCategory field that is one of AI/ART/TECH/CRYPTO/CULTURE) so the UI never needs to show the previous long category strings as the category label.

Adjust experience content metadata to support concise category labeling where categories are displayed (e.g., add a displayCategory field with one of AI/ART/TECH/CRYPTO/CULTURE), ensuring longer strings do not appear in the category label position.

requirements.summary: Add Aurient.ai-matching images to Selects and Experience items, and make each image open in a new tab with proper rel attributes.
acceptanceCriteria: Selects cards display images consistent with the images used on Aurient.ai’s Selects section, and Experience entries display images consistent with Aurient.ai’s Experience section (as applicable).
Clicking an image opens the image in a new tab using target="_blank" and rel="noopener noreferrer".
All images render reliably in production builds (no broken images).
